quest.name: The Intervention
journal: Redolent Rose appears to be in high spirits.

Redolent Rose has decided that the best way to help Wawarukka is to ignore the miner's terrible taste in clothing. To that end, he has taken the liberty of changing Wawarukka's commission. Before you can proceed, you must first obtain approval from the miner. Speak with Wawarukka and obtain his permission.

While surprised by the guildmaster's proposal, Wawarukka is willing to accept it, acknowledging that his ignorance of fashion has been the cause of his previous failures. Craft a woolen beret, gown, and gaskins of the highest quality and present them to Redolent Rose.

During the fitting, a depressed Wawarukka reveals that he saw Kokomo in the company of a wealthy suitor not long ago. Convinced that all is lost, he flees the guild in a fit of despair, proclaiming himself unworthy of Kokomo's affections. Resigned, Redolent Rose states that if Wawarukka is determined to give up, then there is nothing either of you can do to help.

※The next weaver quest will be available from Redolent Rose upon reaching level 50.
objectives: Deliver a woolen beret , a woolen gown , and a pair of woolen gaskins to Redolent Rose.

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: Hah hah hah! It was all so simple! I've conceived of a plan to help poor Wawarukka!

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: He came to me again with another ridiculous commission, and I was completely at a loss as to how to proceed. But then, a stroke of genius!

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: We simply change his order and dress him as we see fit!

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: If we ignore his terrible taste in clothing and give him a stylish outfit, Babawai will have no cause to chase him away, and he will finally have his chance to speak with Kokomo!

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: And I've just the outfit in mind for this occasion: a beret, gown, and gaskins, all made from the finest wool. I daresay he'll be a man reborn when we've finished!

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: Of course, it is necessary that we gain his approval before changing his commission like this, but I am confident that he will see the wisdom in my proposal.

dialogue.name: WAWARUKKA
dialogue.text: Hm? Forename? What're you doin' here? I already told Big Rose what I wanted this time.

dialogue.name: WAWARUKKA
dialogue.text: Oh...he wants to change my order? Well, I s'pose that's alright.

dialogue.name: WAWARUKKA
dialogue.text: I know I'm a fool when it comes to fashion an' all that. Seems I only make things worse when I try harder, too.

dialogue.name: WAWARUKKA
dialogue.text: A woolen beret, gown, and gaskins, was it? Yeah, that sounds nice. I'll meet you there, Forename.

dialogue.name: WAWARUKKA
dialogue.text: Well...I'm here. We doin' this or no?

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: I must confess, I am rather eager to see how this particular commission turns out. Are Wawarukka's garments ready yet?

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: Excellent. I've no doubt these will suit him well.

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: I think we've outdone ourselves, Forename! Just look at him standing there, a vision of grace and refinement!

dialogue.name: WAWARUKKA
dialogue.text: No, I ain't...

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: Is something wrong, sir? I believe they fit you perfectly, but if you desire adjustments─

dialogue.name: WAWARUKKA
dialogue.text: No, no, the clothes are great, Big Rose. Really. It's just, I─ I'm sorry, this was a mistake.

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: What ever are you saying? You look marvelous! Kokomo would be thrilled to receive such a dashing young caller!

dialogue.name: WAWARUKKA
dialogue.text: It's too late. On the way here, I saw her walkin' with this wealthy-lookin' fella. Just the two of 'em.

dialogue.name: WAWARUKKA
dialogue.text: Watchin' 'em together, in their fancy clothes...it looked right, Big Rose. Like they were made for each other.

dialogue.name: WAWARUKKA
dialogue.text: I ain't one of them, don't you see!? You can dress me in your finest silks, but I've still got more dirt under me nails than that girl has in her whole bleedin' manse!

dialogue.name: WAWARUKKA
dialogue.text: I was a fool to think she could care for someone like me! I'll never be part of her world!

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: Leave him be, Forename. If he is determined to give up, then there is naught we can do for him.

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: Though he would be far better served by letting Kokomo decide for herself, Wawarukka must first find the courage to carry on. Only then will he stand a chance.
